subject: fighting the crud
event:
Still fighting the crud here.  Feeling a little better this morning, but still not a hundred per cent.  I did manage to stagger across to my office.  We'll see how long I last.  If I take off too long, the mountain of stuff becomes overwhelming by the time I get back.

And now it appears I've passed on this cold/ flu / whatever to my assistant Ty, who has passed it on to his wife.  A plague sweeping through New Mexico.

I hate feeling sick.  

Hoping to be my old self by the weekend... there's so much bloody work to do...

comments.upictitle: маленький цЫфровой ревербератор Michael Lyahovich: баран
comments.article:
Don't give up!
It's also bad weather now
If you would be in Russia, I shall advise a hot bath :)

there are no hot baths in Russia now because of the &#)%&*# prevention
so I'd prefer to be in the USA these days, huh

I'm sure you've seen this already. It's the basic truth of our present informational surge that everyone is the last person to see/hear/read something in the world. However, I also know that we should continue to point out items of interest in the hopes that we are sharing new knowledge. With that said, here's a link to what I think is a great defense of writers and deadlines:

http://journal.neilgaiman.com/2009/05/entitlement-issues.html

(Of course, you need to scroll down to see the part that I'm talking about.)
comments.subject: An interesting open letter

comments.article:
Just came here to post that!
Well said Neil.

And feel better soon Mr. Martin =)
comments.subject: Re: An interesting open letter

comments.article:
;___;
I'm sorry, I still hope you get well soon.
Drink lots and lots of juice and all that jazz.
<3
We'll keep the good thoughts flowing your way - but we're keeping an eye on the AZ border until we know you're in the clear!

My grandmother would always advocate having some boiled cabbage water and honey to ward off illness. Generally though you should take time and just relax. Readers like myself and other fans from Killarney, Ireland would happily send on the cabbage water and honey if it helps :-) Of course you could drink the cabbage water by itself but after years of experience I wouldn't recommend that.

I saw this post on Neil Gaiman's blog and thought it would interest you.

http://journal.neilgaiman.com/2009/05/entitlement-issues.html

All the best,
Daniel
comments.subject: Get Well Soon

comments.article: haha, I love it.
comments.subject: Re: Get Well Soon

comments.article: *makes you some soup* ^-^ Hope you feel better soon!
Echoing the other comments above, just remind the flu that you're not it's bitch.  That'll learn 'em!!
I hope you're all feeling better soon.
Hope you feel better. We have the GI crud rolling through the deep dark south, which lasts about 5 days and makes a human impersonate a sea cucumber. No fun at all.
Feel better soon.
Well wishes for a speedy recovery!

comments.upictitle: joemorf: Ser joemorf - Order of the Pink Dog
comments.article:
Nobody likes the creeping crud.

If the home remedies suggested in the comments to your last post didn't do the trick, may I suggest a hot toddy (or four?).

Granted, the medicinal efficacy of Bushmills is debatable, but at least you won't mind being sick so much...

Get well soon!

~j
I too, was coming her to post about how Neil has your back, yo, but you've already been linked several times so...Hee.  I hope you get better soon.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: horns
comments.article: Hope you feel better soon.
I hope you virus checked this post! ;o)

Your assistant is sick? Assistants aren't allowed to get sick! You should have included an "impervious to sickness" clause to the employment contract.

You may also look into a "grim reaper forbearance" (for Ty, of course).

Russ
comments.subject: Sick assistant

comments.article: Glad to hear you are feeling a bit better.  I hate illness when the sun is shining.  Flus and colds should be relegated to the winter where they belong.

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: pic#124268277
comments.article:
Two Emergen C a day (I like tangerine), and lots of Green tea. It helps it to go away a little bit faster.

I'm learning this the hard way. I never used to get sick, but now almost every time I go out my baby gets something, and then I get it from him. Probably something to do with kissing his face when he's covered in drool.
Feel better!  In Ann Arbor, the lilacs are blooming, and they are beautiful, but they are killing me.  And my productivity!  I have empathy.  I wish you tea.
I'd like to advocate a Hot Toddy. Good for what ales you. I mean ails you.

Hm, knocking your assistant out of commission while you yourself were already out of commission was probably not the smartest thing. I'm sure you had your reasons though.

Feel better. :-)

comments.upictitle: Jax: ff7 yuffie bw color materia
comments.article:
There have been some nasty, nasty sicknesses passing around since the Christmas season. I caught bronchitis in December, which turned into pnuemonia, then reverted back to bronchitis, all while I was in the middle of a grueling college semester earlier this year. Somehow, I managed to be able to go on my spring break Panama trip somehwat healthy, but it took months to recover.

I hope you get well much sooner than I am! Good luck, sir.

So feeling for you right now - I've caught a cold and am sneezing like crazy.

Get better soon!
i myself just got over a major death cold so i can sympathize! rest up and feel better!
Well, you probably have the swine flu. So what you should do is panic and run around in circles. I hear that's the best cure.
